description.narrative:
My Village (MVi), with funding support from Inclusion Project, is implementing the project called " Community Participation and Engagement in Water Resource Management." This project covers 16 village, 7 communes and 3 districts in Stung Treng province.The goal of the project is to improve law enforcement on fishery sector and reduce impacts of hydro-power dam on communities of 16 affected villages of Lower Sesan II, in Sesan district, Stung Treng province and hold sub-national government accountable and responding to those issues.
My Village (MVi) was founded in November 2006 and officially registered with the Ministry of Interior in 25 January 2007. It was recognized as a local NGO working for Indigenous Peoples' Rights and Natural Resources Management. MVi encourages ownership and participation of Indigenous Peoples# as its approaches to protect their land and natural resources. MVi is operating in Northeast provinces of Cambodia, in particular in Mondulkiri, Kratie and Stung Treng, and focused onorganizing community forests, helping indigenous people learn about their rights, helping women become empowered, and facilitating communities in undertaking various development projects. Oxfam water governance funds MVi for implementing the project called #Community participation and engagement in water resource management.# The project is implementing in 16 villages , 7 communes, 3 districts of Stung Treng province where proposed hydropower dam named #Stung Treng dam# in the Mekong Mainstream and Operational Lower Sesan 2 in the Mekong tributary which relocated more than 5000 people from the dam site, located. The project is implementing from April 2017 until March 2019. The project will work directly with 109 people (43 females) and 12213 (5817 female) people in the mentioned target area.
The project goal is that the issues of 12 communities in 16 villages in Lower Sesan district impacted from Lower Sesan 2 hydropower project are responded andaddressed by end of 2019. The two main objectives are1) Community capacity on water governance and fishery protection increased andengaged with authorities to voice their concerns and 2) community issues around water infrastructure and fisheries are addressed bylocal authorities. This project engages affected communities# people including women, men, youth and indigenous people to participate in dialogue with local authorities for compensation and improvement of fishery and water resource protection and management in the target area.

participating-org.narrative: My Village (MVi) was founded in November 2006 and officially registered with the Ministry of Interior in 25 January 2007. Ever since, MVi became a recognized local NGO working for Indigenous Peoples' Rights and Natural Resources Management. MVi encourages ownership and participation of Indigenous Peoples# as its approaches to protect their land and natural resources. MVi is operating in Northeast provinces of Cambodia, in particular in Mondulkiri, Kratie and Stung Treng, and focused on organizing community forests, helping indigenous people learn about their rights, helping women become empowered, and facilitating communities in undertaking various development projects. MVi has been worked in collaboration with Community Networks, Provincial and National NGO networks, and line of government institutions at the national and provincial level of Department of Local Administrative of Ministry of Interior, Department of Forestry Administrative, Department of Agriculture, Department of Environment, Department of Land Use Management, and Department of Rural Development.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Oxfam Australia funding with back donor
